body_content.explanation: a deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn) from China and Japan that is grown for its dark blue-green leaves that become yellow or red in autumn and have a sweet smell:
examples: A magnificent katsura tree just outside the house gives off a scent similar to caramel.
The statue was carved from a single block of wood from a Katsura tree.
Katsuras naturally make more than a dozen trunks, spreading outwards from the base.
